column1: In the case of G.P.A De Silva and others v Sadique and Others (1978-79-80) SLR 166, 171, a
divisional bench of 5 judges of the Supreme Court held that;
"The  classic  statement  in  regard  to  when  a  Writ  of  Certiorari  will  issue  is  however
found in the judgment of Lord Atkin in R v Electricity Commissioners, in which he held
that writs of certiorari and prohibition may "wherever anybody of persons having legal
authority to determine questions affecting the rights of subjects, and having the duty
to act judicially act in excess of their legal authority"
